The programmer of the next century!

== Kenneth Lamar Noid ==
  +
On January 30, 1989, Kenneth Lamar Noid, a [[mentally ill]] customer who thought the ads were a personal attack on him, held two employees of an [[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], Domino's restaurant [[hostage]] for over five hours. After forcing them to make him a pizza and making demands for $100,000, getaway transportation, and a copy of ''[[The Historical Illuminatus Chronicles|The Widow's Son]]'', Noid surrendered to the police.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,151193,00.html | title=Business Notes: Advertising Characters | publisher=TIME | date=1989-02-13 | accessdate=2006-11-13}}</ref> After the incident had ended, police Chief Reed Miller offered a memorable assessment to reporters: "He's paranoid."<ref>[http://www.encyclopedia.com/doc/1P2-3926396.html Noid muffs Domino's robbery - Chicago Sun-Times | Encyclopedia.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Noid was charged with [[kidnapping]], [[Assault#Aggravated assault|aggravated assault]], [[extortion]], and [[Concealed carry in the United States#Weapon possession|possession of a firearm]] during a crime. He was found [[insanity defense|not guilty by reason of insanity]].
